title: Forest Service Cost Reduction and Fiscal Accountability Act of 1998
content: Forest Service Cost Reduction and Fiscal Accountability Act of 1998 - Directs the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service, to prepare an implementation schedule for a Forest System accounting system to be known as the All Resources Accounting System which shall include: (1) specified program areas, (2) cost allocations, (3) identification of indirect expenditures and general administration costs. And (4) separate reports for Forest System units, State and private forestry, and research. Directs the Secretary to: (1) limit and eliminate within a certain period indirect expenditures from Forest Service trust funds or permanent appropriations. (2) disclose indirect expenditures and general administration costs in annual budget requests. And (3) prepare a five-year Forest System cost reduction strategic plan.
